rComments: Alice was very clear on what she expected of you for her midterm and final. She was very clear during lecture, did example problems, and the homework was similar to her notes.  She is also very sweet! Her tests are very similar to her notes, homework, and midtermfinal review problems. Just understand those and you'll get an A!

Tact and professional. No nonsense, and if there is, we get a chuckle. If you look at her lecture notes (which she puts online with great detail) as you do the homework, then review 'em both for the midterm and the final, you'll be fine. I never even bought the textbook, and (I'm pretty sure) I passed quite easily. Dunno what to complain about!
I love what she teaches. I really don't much in class but I can always review at home. She is very nice and I love to ask her questions in office hours. I recommend to take her class.

This class was incredibly frustrating. She gives minimal examples in lecture and assigns problems that were never even remotely covered. Key formulas were often missing from her notes, making it even more confusing. I attended class and read and still had to google the majority of the homework. If you can take this with someone else, DO!
Go to her office hours! She is very nice and she will help you if you ask for it!

You can honestly skip lecture and you won't miss a thing. I learned by her lecture notes (posted online) and section. In class she doesn't go over examples instead she derives equations which isn't necessary to know at all. She's an easy grader so if you can't solve a problem at least write the equation(s) or draw a picture and you'll get points.
